newsitem.title: FINLAND: POLL - MARKKA SEEN A BIT FIRMER VS MARK TO JUNE.
newsitem.headline: POLL - MARKKA SEEN A BIT FIRMER VS MARK TO JUNE.

text.p: The Finnish markka is expected to inch a couple of penni stronger against the German mark in the next three months, according to a Reuters poll.
In March next year, the markka is seen back near its current levels around 2.99 per mark and DEM/FIM is seen trading in a 2.90-3.05 range during the coming 12 months.
A large majority of respondents, 19 of 23 dealers, analysts and economists, forecast DEM/FIM in a 2.95-2.99 range until June. The median was 2.95 and the mean 2.96.
Two market operators expected DEM/FIM to fall to 2.90 and two saw it at 3.00 by the beginning of June.
Against the dollar, the markka was expected to trade close to its current levels at 5.05 in the next three months. The median forecast was 5.05 in a 4.75-5.16 range. The mean was 5.03.
Six respondents estimated USD/FIM to fall below 5.00, while four saw it rising to 5.15-5.16.
Looking one year ahead, the median forecast for DEM/FIM was 3.01 in a 2.75-3.07 range. The mean was 2.99.
Four participants forecast the markka at 2.90 or below by March 1998 but most, 15 of the 23, expected the markka to be in a range of 3.00-3.04 per mark. One bank forecast DEM/FIM at 3.07.
When asked about the DEM/FIM trading range during the coming 12 months, the median forecast of lows was 2.90, while that of highs stood at 3.05.
The range of DEM/FIM lows forecasts was 2.70-2.94 and that of highs 2.98-3.13.
Six respondents expected lows to be under 2.90. Seven estimated highs of 3.06 or above.
The markka was expected to gain against the dollar by next March. The median of USD/FIM forecasts was 4.92 in a 4.50-5.45 range. The mean was 4.94.
Seven respondents saw USD/FIM falling to 4.75 or lower while five forecast it to climb to 5.20 or above.
The poll was conducted on by telephone on February 27. Forecasts were collected on an anonymous basis.

Forecasts by Aktia Bank, Bank of America (London), Banque Indosuez (Stockholm), CD Derivatives Ltd., Davy Protos, Den Danske Bank (Copenhagen), Enso, Handelsbanken Markets Finland, Huhtamaki Finance, I.D.E.A. (London), Interbank, IVO, Kemira, Kesko, Merita Bank, Neste, Nokia, OKOBANK, Postipankki, SE-Banken (Helsinki), SOK, Unibank (Copenhagen) and UPM-Kymmene.
